description: Smallest positive number that must be added to n to reach a palindrome.
comments: The pattern breaks down as for instance 99 need be added only with 2 instead of 11.More precisely, the pattern changes (shape and length) at n=9, n=99, n=999, etc. - _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 26 2014
prog: (PARI) a(n)=for(k=1,9e19,is_A002113(n+k)&&return(k)) \\ For illustrative purpose only, inefficient for most large numbers. - _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 26 2014
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Dec 15 1999.
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 17 2009 at the suggestion of _R. J. Mathar_
